channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2024050637
item.description:
Report E-2024050637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1/2-gallon of battery acid was released from a 1345-pound heavy machinery battery due to improper loading by terminal UDV. The release impacted trailer #3117838 at dock door 22. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024050666
item.description:
Report E-2024050666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: terminal URE contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Sparks, NV. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Pinnacle High Build Epoxy Satin Chocolate, which released from 1-1 gallon metal can due to another pallet colliding with the can during loading, spilling the product onto the box and the trailer floor. A total of 4-1 gallon cans were impacted
